With 240+ fatalities, this could result in payouts exceeding â‚¹240 crore. *ğŸ”¸ Total Projected Insurance Payout:* Combined hull and liability exposures may cross â‚¹1,000â€“1,500 crore, depending on final settlements and legal claims. *ğŸ”¸ Risk Distribution:* Indian insurers retain only around 5% of the exposure, amounting to â‚¹50â€“75 crore, while the bulk will be absorbed by foreign reinsurers. *ğŸ”¸ Policy Scale:* Air Indiaâ€™s fleet-wide aviation cover reportedly runs into â‚¹8,000â€“10,000 crore, with an annual premium estimated around â‚¹250 crore. *ğŸ“Œ Market Impact:* This incident is likely to harden the global aviation insurance market, especially for wide-body aircraft operators in Asia.
